TaskDescription.Summary: Execute only when conditions are met
TaskDescription.Detail: Ask the user to enter a score, print pass or fail, ask the user to enter whether to retake the exam and print guide messages.

Assist.value: Ask the user to enter the score and store it.
Specify a variable to store the value entered by the user. Type this.score.
Enter a guide message as below. 'Enter your test score.'
The next steps are executed only when the score is 100 or less.
Enter a condition as below. this.score<=100
The next steps are executed respectively depending on whether score is above 70 or not.
Enter a condition as below. this.score>=70
A messagebox is displayed when the score is above 70.
Type a sentence to be printed as below. 'You passed the exam.'
A messagebox is displayed when the score is less than 70.
Type a sentence to be printed as below. 'You failed the exam.'
Ask the user to enter whether to retake the exam and store it.
Specify a variable to store whether to retake the exam. Type this.retry.
Enter a guide message as below. 'Would you like to retake the exam?? Type Y or N.'
The next step is executed respectively depending on what the user entered.
Enter a variable to apply the condition. Type this.retry.
Define execution when the user entered 'Y'.
Enter 'Y'.
Display a message box when 'Y' was entered.
Type a sentence to be printed as below. 'Go for it!'
Define execution when the user entered 'N'.
Enter 'N'.
Display a message box when 'N' was entered.
Type a sentence to be printed as below. 'Too bad!'
Define execution when the user entered neither 'Y' nor 'N'.
Display a message box when neither 'Y' nor 'N' was entered.
Type a sentence to be printed as below. 'Wrong input.'
Execution was complete depending on whether score is above 70 or not.
Execution was complete when the score is 100 or less.
